summary: No level of lead is safe in drinking water. Lead accumulates in the body over time, causing long-lasting effects, particularly for children and pregnant women. The Lead and Copper Rule generally requires water systems to test for lead and treat water to help prevent corroded pipes from leaching lead into the water. title: Drinking Water: Additional Data and Statistical Analysis May Enhance EPA's Oversight of the Lead and Copper Rule
